sn47.26:4.1: At one time Venerables Sāriputta, Mahāmoggallāna, and Anuruddha were staying near Sāketa, in the Thorny Wood.
sn47.26:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna came out of solitude, went to Anuruddha,
sn47.26:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
sn47.26:4.6: “Reverend, they speak of this person called ‘a trainee’.
sn47.26:4.8: “Reverends, a trainee is someone who has partly developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.26:5.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.26:5.3: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.26:5.5: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.26:5.6: A trainee is someone who has partly developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
